intro: Artrolobium parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered artrolobium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to conserve water. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Artrolobium parviflorum is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry climates.
